content.description: Stand start on the left side of the west face. Move up and hit the crux moving over the lip onto the steep slope and top out.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. There's a lot of driftwood underneath so more pads may be better. The down climb is on the east face.
content.location: The problem starts on the left side of the west face. Reference picture for more information.

content.description: Squat start on a left hand rail and positive right foot. from there, move slightly over the lip to a positive right hand crimp. There's a right foot jib (the width of 3 quarters), step high and hit a let hand sloper-crimp. There's a big rail above you'll head towards and then top out.
content.protection: The landing is questionable with large pieces of driftwood but two pads seemed to make a relatively level landing. The more pads the better.
content.location: The problem is located on the northeast corner of the boulder. The down climb is on the east side of the boulder.
